verses.verse: For, behold, the Lord <WH113>, the LORD <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635>, doth take away <WH5493> from Jerusalem <WH3389> and from Judah <WH3063> the stay <WH4937> and the staff <WH4938>, the whole stay <WH4937> of bread <WH3899>, and the whole <WH3605> stay <WH4937> of water <WH4325>,
The mighty man <WH1368>, and the man <WH376> of war <WH4421>, the judge <WH8199>, and the prophet <WH5030>, and the prudent <WH7080>, and the ancient <WH2205>,

The captain <WH8269> of fifty <WH2572>, and the honourable <WH5375> man <WH6440>, and the counsellor <WH3289>, and the cunning <WH2450> artificer <WH2791>, and the eloquent <WH995> orator <WH3908>. the honourable: Heb. a man eminent in countenance eloquent: or, skilful of speech
And I will give <WH5414> children <WH5288> to be their princes <WH8269>, and babes <WH8586> shall rule <WH4910> over them.

And the people <WH5971> shall be oppressed <WH5065>, every one <WH376> by another <WH376>, and every one <WH376> by his neighbour <WH7453>: the child <WH5288> shall behave himself proudly <WH7292> against the ancient <WH2205>, and the base <WH7034> against the honourable <WH3513>.

When a man <WH376> shall take hold <WH8610> of his brother <WH251> of the house <WH1004> of his father <WH1>, saying, Thou hast clothing <WH8071>, be thou our ruler <WH7101>, and let this ruin <WH4384> be under thy hand <WH3027>:

In that day <WH3117> shall he swear <WH5375>, saying <WH559>, I will not be an healer <WH2280>; for in my house <WH1004> is neither bread <WH3899> nor clothing <WH8071>: make <WH7760> me not a ruler <WH7101> of the people <WH5971>. swear: Heb. lift up the hand healer: Heb. binder up

For Jerusalem <WH3389> is ruined <WH3782>, and Judah <WH3063> is fallen <WH5307>: because their tongue <WH3956> and their doings <WH4611> are against the LORD <WH3068>, to provoke <WH4784> the eyes <WH5869> of his glory <WH3519>.

The shew <WH1971> of their countenance <WH6440> doth witness against them <WH6030>; and they declare <WH5046> their sin <WH2403> as Sodom <WH5467>, they hide <WH3582> it not. Woe <WH188> unto their soul <WH5315>! for they have rewarded <WH1580> evil <WH7451> unto themselves.
Say <WH559> ye to the righteous <WH6662>, that it shall be well <WH2896> with him: for they shall eat <WH398> the fruit <WH6529> of their doings <WH4611>.
Woe <WH188> unto the wicked <WH7563>! it shall be ill <WH7451> with him: for the reward <WH1576> of his hands <WH3027> shall be given <WH6213> him. given: Heb. done to him

As for my people <WH5971>, children <WH5953> are their oppressors <WH5065>, and women <WH802> rule <WH4910> over them. O my people <WH5971>, they which lead <WH833> thee cause thee to err <WH8582>, and destroy <WH1104> the way <WH1870> of thy paths <WH734>. lead: or, call thee blessed destroy: Heb. swallow up
The LORD <WH3068> standeth up <WH5324> to plead <WH7378>, and standeth <WH5975> to judge <WH1777> the people <WH5971>.

The LORD <WH3068> will enter <WH935> into judgment <WH4941> with the ancients <WH2205> of his people <WH5971>, and the princes <WH8269> thereof: for ye have eaten up <WH1197> the vineyard <WH3754>; the spoil <WH1500> of the poor <WH6041> is in your houses <WH1004>. eaten: or, burnt
What mean ye that ye beat <WH1792> my people <WH5971> to pieces <WH1792>, and grind <WH2912> the faces <WH6440> of the poor <WH6041>? saith <WH5002> the Lord <WH136> GOD <WH3069> of hosts <WH6635>.

Moreover the LORD <WH3068> saith <WH559>, Because <WH3282> the daughters <WH1323> of Zion <WH6726> are haughty <WH1361>, and walk <WH3212> with stretched forth <WH5186> necks <WH1627> and wanton <WH8265> eyes <WH5869>, walking <WH1980> and mincing <WH2952> as they go <WH3212>, and making a tinkling <WH5913> with their feet <WH7272>: wanton: Heb. deceiving with their eyes mincing: or, tripping nicely

Therefore the Lord <WH136> will smite with a scab <WH5596> the crown of the head <WH6936> of the daughters <WH1323> of Zion <WH6726>, and the LORD <WH3068> will discover <WH6168> their secret parts <WH6596>. discover: Heb. make naked

In that day <WH3117> the Lord <WH136> will take away <WH5493> the bravery <WH8597> of their tinkling ornaments <WH5914> about their feet, and their cauls <WH7636>, and their round tires like the moon <WH7720>, cauls: or, networks
The chains <WH5188>, and the bracelets <WH8285>, and the mufflers <WH7479>, chains: or, sweet balls mufflers: or, spangled ornaments
The bonnets <WH6287>, and the ornaments of the legs <WH6807>, and the headbands <WH7196>, and the tablets <WH5315> <WH1004>, and the earrings <WH3908>, tablets: Heb. houses of the soul
The rings <WH2885>, and nose <WH639> jewels <WH5141>,
The changeable suits of apparel <WH4254>, and the mantles <WH4595>, and the wimples <WH4304>, and the crisping pins <WH2754>,
The glasses <WH1549>, and the fine linen <WH5466>, and the hoods <WH6797>, and the vails <WH7289>.

And it shall come to pass, that instead of sweet smell <WH1314> there shall be stink <WH4716>; and instead of a girdle <WH2290> a rent <WH5364>; and instead of well set <WH4639> hair <WH4748> baldness <WH7144>; and instead of a stomacher <WH6614> a girding <WH4228> of sackcloth <WH8242>; and burning <WH3587> instead of beauty <WH3308>.
Thy men <WH4962> shall fall <WH5307> by the sword <WH2719>, and thy mighty <WH1369> in the war <WH4421>. mighty: Heb. might
And her gates <WH6607> shall lament <WH578> and mourn <WH56>; and she being desolate <WH5352> shall sit <WH3427> upon the ground <WH776>. desolate: or, emptied: Heb. cleansed
